text:
Dilations and Similar Figures

The Problems in the first three Investigations focus on comparing figures to see if they have identical shape and size under reflections, translations, or rotations. We answered the question:

What transformations preserve congruent shapes?

We know, from earlier work in curriculum/fsss/images/screenshot-2024-04-21-at-4.53.44 pm.png, that interesting things happen when we enlarge or reduce a figure. We created and analyzed many scale drawings or similar shapes in Stretching and Shrinking.

For example, we used a rubber band tool to enlarge a picture on a flyer.

Which characters are members of the Wump family, and which are impostors?

Which of the Mugs are similar? How do you know?

For those that are similar, what is the scale factor?
